hero.description: Subcult is a cooperative for creators, developers, and cultural agitators. We're looking for passionate people who want to build something different.

structure.title: Membership Structure
points: All active contributors become voting members

applicationProcess.title: APPLICATION PROCESS
applicationProcess.subtitle: How to join the collective

steps.title: Submit Application
steps.description: Fill out the contact form below with your information, work samples, and why you want to join.

steps.title: Initial Review
steps.description: Our membership committee reviews your application (typically within 2 weeks).

steps.title: Interview & Discussion
steps.description: If selected, you'll have a conversation with current members to discuss fit and expectations.

steps.title: Trial Period
steps.description: New members start with a 3-month trial period to ensure mutual fit before full membership.

applicationProcess.timeline: The entire process typically takes 4-6 weeks from application to decision.
requirements: Portfolio or work samples demonstrating your practice
Clear vision for how you'd contribute to the collective
Availability for onboarding and regular participation

questions.question: Do I need to be a full-time creator?
questions.answer: No. Many of our members have day jobs. We value quality contributions over quantity of time spent.

questions.question: Is there a membership fee?
questions.answer: We have minimal dues to cover operational costs, decided democratically by members. Financial barriers should never prevent participation.

questions.question: What if I can't attend meetings?
questions.answer: We understand life happens. Remote participation is always an option, and we record key meetings for those who can't attend.

questions.question: Can I leave the cooperative?
questions.answer: Yes, membership is voluntary. We ask for 30 days notice so we can transition any ongoing projects.

questions.question: What disciplines do you accept?
questions.answer: All creative and technical disciplines: artists, designers, developers, writers, musicians, filmmakers, and more.

questions.question: How do you handle conflicts?
questions.answer: We have a conflict resolution process based on mediation and collective discussion. Our goal is always to find solutions that work for everyone.
